t: Isaiah 9
The Government of the Promised Son

Nevertheless*pn the gloom will*i not be*i upon her who is*i distressed, As*ld when at first He lightly esteemed The*ld land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, And*ld afterward more heavily oppressed her,*i By*ild the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, In*ld Galilee of the Gentiles.
The*ld people who walked in darkness Have*ld seen a great light; Those*ld who dwelt in the land of the shadow of death, Upon*ld them a light has shined.
You*ln have multiplied the nation And*ild increased its joy; They*ld rejoice before You According*ld to the joy of harvest, As*ld men*i rejoice when they divide the spoil.
For*ld You have broken the yoke of his burden And*ld the staff of his shoulder, The*ld rod of his oppressor, As*ld in the day of Midian.
For*ld every warrior’s sandal from the noisy battle, And*ld garments rolled in blood, Will*ld be used for burning and*i fuel of fire.

For*ln unto us a Child is born, Unto*ld us a Son is given; And*ld the government will be upon His shoulder. And*ld His name will be called Wonderful,*ld Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting*ld Father, Prince of Peace.

Of*ld the increase of His*i government and peace There*ild will*i be*i no end, Upon*ld the throne of David and over His kingdom, To*ld order it and establish it with judgment and justice From*ld that time forward, even forever. The*ld zeal of the Lord*s of hosts will perform this.
The Punishment of Samaria
The*pn Lord sent a word against Jacob, And*ld it has fallen on Israel.
All*ld the people will know— Ephraim*ld and the inhabitant of Samaria— Who*ld say in pride and arrogance of heart:
“The*ld bricks have fallen down, But*ld we will rebuild with hewn stones; The*ld sycamores are cut down, But*ld we will replace them*i with cedars.”
Therefore*ld the Lord*s shall set up The*ld adversaries of Rezin against him, And*ld spur his enemies on,
The*ld Syrians before and the Philistines behind; And*ld they shall devour Israel with an open mouth. For*ln all this His anger is not turned away, But*ld His hand is*i stretched out still.
For*ln the people do not turn to Him who strikes them, Nor*ld do they seek the Lord*s of hosts.
Therefore*ld the Lord*s will cut off head and tail from Israel, Palm*ld branch and bulrush in one day.
The*ld elder and honorable, he is*i the head; The*ld prophet who teaches lies, he is*i the tail.
For*ld the leaders of this people cause them*i to err, And*ld those*i who*i are*i led by them are destroyed.

Therefore*ld the Lord will have no joy in their young men, Nor*ld have mercy on their fatherless and widows; For*ld everyone is*i a hypocrite and an evildoer, And*ld every mouth speaks folly. For*ln all this His anger is not turned away, But*ld His hand is*i stretched out still.
For*ln wickedness burns as the fire; It*ld shall devour the briers and thorns, And*ld kindle in the thickets of the forest; They*ld shall mount up like*i rising smoke.
Through*ld the wrath of the Lord*s of hosts The*ld land is burned up, And*ld the people shall be as fuel for the fire; No*ld man shall spare his brother.
And*ld he shall snatch on the right hand And*ld be hungry; He*ld shall devour on the left hand And*ld not be satisfied; Every*ld man shall eat the flesh of his own arm.
Manasseh*ld shall*i devour*i Ephraim, and Ephraim Manasseh; Together*ld they shall*i be*i against Judah. For*ln all this His anger is not turned away, But*ld His hand is*i stretched out still.
